intro: Koeleria rohlfsii var. dolosa, commonly known as the desert needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces fine, thread-like leaves and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife. Koeleria rohlfsii var. dolosa is often found in sandy or gravelly soils along the edges of deserts and in sagebrush steppe habitats.
